Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2015 02:10PM HopefulandScared wrote: Cysts are easy to differentiate with imaging. If the radiologist said it is a cyst, then it is a cyst. I've worked in imaging for over a decade. Anything that doesn't look homogeneous like a cyst goes for further investigation. The itching is usually from the space where there was once nothing, and now is stretching to accommodate the annoying cyst.
Posts.Title: Am I being paranoid or do I need to pursue this? y1981m art15
